messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Digest Number 87
messages.msgSnippet: OMD!!!! That IS the internet version of Oh my Dodd, right? I was laughing soooo hard on that park incident.....impaled on shards of frozen cooler?  Someone has
messages.messageBody:
OMD!!!!
That IS the internet version of Oh my Dodd, right?
I was laughing soooo hard on that park incident.....impaled on shards of
frozen cooler? Someone has entirely too much time on their hands!!! Or too
creative maybe?
Oh, that's right. You're unschoolers...you have an abundance of BOTH!!! Cool.

Welcome Cathy,
I thought I was Christian too....beginning to think I will convert to being a
Holtie.
LOL!
I'm still chuckling...geez, you guys are so funny.
Sure, you can be an unschooler and Christian...in that order. Just kidding.
I guess I'm a little leery of a lot of people that say Christian/unschooling
in the same breath because of many forms of control I see Christians using on
their kids...all in the name of God/religion, which bothers me.
I don't think that's what Christ was all about anyway.
I love Jesus, I love what he taught, I love reading about him.
So I claim Christianity.
You aren't alone. But I am not any one "brand" of Christian....so it's hard
to fit in sometimes. Which obviously bothers me a lot (using sarcastic voice).
I think there are some benefits to starting a Church of Holt here
folks..,....but first I want to see the robes. Being a makeup consultant, I
have to make sure it looks good on me!!! haha
Love your quote Patricia!
I gave my mom a little painting with a quote "who walks the world with soul
awake finds beauty everywhere"
I think it's a Frost quote? Can't remember now.
Anyway, it's a great line you posted.
Ren
